body_html: @ezyang That failures are reproduced and fixed now (sorry, can't squash my commits any longer). They are about forcing algos which are not supported for given parameters (like I mentioned in my previous comment). Now Caffe2 handles such use cases properly: if algorithm chosen by user is not supported, it falls back to default one (determinism honored) and issues a warning. It's more user friendly than crash (NVCaffe actually does the same).

They are about forcing algos which are not supported for given parameters (like I mentioned in my previous comment). Now Caffe2 handles such use cases properly: if algorithm chosen by user is not supported, it falls back to default one (determinism honored) and issues a warning. It's more user friendly than crash (NVCaffe actually does the same).
